intro: Peperomia lewisii, commonly known as Lewis’s pepper plant, is a compact, low-growing perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features thick, waxy, ovate leaves that are typically green with a slight reddish tinge on the underside. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, which are usually greenish-white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright indirect light. Peperomia lewisii is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its drought tolerance and ease of care.
